exercises.instruction: Put in at, on or in.

items.prompt: The meeting starts ____ 9.30.
My cousin was born ____ 2006.
We’re going away ____ the weekend.
I usually feel sleepy ____ the afternoon.
The shop is closed ____ Sunday.
I woke up ____ the night because of a storm.
I’ll see you ____ Friday evening.
The exam is ____ 12 June.
They moved here ____ March.
I’m really busy ____ the moment.
The concert finishes ____ midnight.
We met ____ the summer of 2018.
She always calls her mum ____ her birthday.
The plane lands ____ 6.05 a.m.
I like walking ____ the morning.
We often go out ____ Saturday night.
He left school ____ 1999.
I’ll send you the details ____ Monday.
The streets are quiet ____ night.
Our neighbours moved in ____ the end of April.
The hotel is cheaper ____ winter.
She phoned me ____ lunchtime.

exercises.instruction: Complete each sentence with at, on or in.

items.prompt: I’ll be back ____ two hours.
We’re meeting ____ Tuesday afternoon.
I can’t talk now. Call me back ____ a few minutes.
The temperature is often below zero ____ January.
The next train is ____ 10.12.
We usually exchange gifts ____ Christmas.
Our class starts ____ the morning, not in the evening.
They got married ____ 14 February.
Let’s talk ____ the end of the lesson.
The café is busy ____ lunchtime.

exercises.instruction: Choose a, b or both.

items.prompt:
a) I’ll see you on Friday.
b) I’ll see you Friday.

a) We’re meeting next Tuesday.
b) We’re meeting on next Tuesday.

a) The office is closed on 1 May.
b) The office is closed in 1 May.

a) I’m staying here at the weekend.
b) I’m staying here on the weekend.

a) The train leaves at 7.20.
b) The train leaves on 7.20.

a) She was born in 1998.
b) She was born on 1998.

a) I’m busy at the moment.
b) I’m busy in the moment.

a) They’ll arrive in ten minutes.
b) They’ll arrive at ten minutes.

a) He works at night.
b) He works in night.

a) We had dinner on Monday evening.
b) We had dinner in Monday evening.

exercises.instruction: Complete with on time or in time.

items.prompt: The bus was late, so I wasn’t ____ for my appointment.
We left early to get to the airport ____.
I’ll try to be there ____ (not late).
Did you finish the report ____ for the meeting?
The film started exactly at 8.00 — right ____.
I got to the station just ____ to catch the last train.
Please arrive ____ — the class begins at 6.
We hurried so we’d be back ____ for dinner.
I saved the document ____ before the computer crashed.

exercises.instruction: Complete each sentence with just in time.

items.prompt: I caught the door before it closed — I got there ____.
We arrived ____ to hear the start of the speech.
He stopped the car ____ (at the last moment).
I reached the platform ____ and the train was still there.

exercises.instruction: Complete with at the end of.

items.prompt: We had coffee ____ the meeting.
There’s a summary ____ this chapter.
They shook hands ____ the game.
I’ll call you ____ the day.
Write your name ____ the form.

exercises.instruction: Complete with in the end.

items.prompt: We discussed it for hours, but ____ we agreed.
I didn’t want to go, but ____ I changed my mind.
It was a hard decision. ____ we chose the cheaper option.
She tried different jobs and ____ became a nurse.

exercises.instruction: Complete with at or in.

items.prompt: ____ the end of the street there’s a small park.
We were tired, but ____ the end we finished the climb.
I’ll see you ____ the end of the week.
____ the end, nobody complained.
There’s a note ____ the end of this email.
We argued a lot. ____ the end we apologised.
____ the end of the film, everyone was crying.
He didn’t want to move, but ____ the end he did.
The score was 0–0 until ____ the end of the match.
____ the end, the plan worked perfectly.

exercises.instruction: Complete with in, at or on.

items.prompt: The children are playing ____ the garden.
Meet me ____ the bus stop outside the museum.
Your phone is ____ the table.
I left my wallet ____ my bag.
There’s someone waiting ____ the door.
I wrote the address ____ the envelope.
We sat ____ the balcony and watched the sunset.
They live ____ a small village near the sea.

exercises.instruction: Put in in, at or on.

items.prompt: There’s a mirror ____ the wall.
We arrived ____ the station early.
I saw your name ____ the list.
He was sitting ____ the corner of the room.
Please wait ____ the entrance.
The cat is asleep ____ the sofa.
She works ____ an office in the city centre.
Put the milk ____ the fridge.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with in, at or on.

items.prompt: I met her ____ the airport.
There’s a stain ____ your shirt.
My grandparents live ____ Canada.
Don’t leave food ____ the floor.
We stopped ____ a small café for lunch.
The key is ____ my pocket.
Hang the picture ____ the wall.
I’m waiting ____ the end of the street.
There were dozens of people ____ the room.
Your glasses are ____ your head!
Let’s meet ____ the corner near the bank.
She lives ____ the third floor.
We spent the afternoon ____ the park.
Write the date ____ the top of the page.

exercises.instruction: Complete with in, on or at.

items.prompt: There’s a line of taxis ____ the station.
I saw your comment ____ the website.
The supermarket is ____ the end of this road.
We queued ____ a long row outside the theatre.
The village is ____ the coast.
There’s a small dot ____ the map.
I can see a plane ____ the sky.
His name is ____ the list.
The bookshop is ____ the corner of this street.
She’s standing ____ the front of the building.

exercises.instruction: Put in in, on or at.

items.prompt: There’s a garden ____ the back of the house.
I sat ____ the back of the car.
Write the answer ____ the back of the page.
The driver is ____ the front of the bus.
There’s a notice ____ the front of the door.
We waited ____ the front of the cinema.
He found a photo ____ the back of the drawer.
The address is printed ____ the front of the envelope.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with in, on or at.

items.prompt: There’s a picture ____ the wall to the right of the window.
The title is ____ the top of the page.
We stopped for coffee ____ the way home.
I left my bag ____ the corner of the room.
The café is ____ the corner near the post office.
There’s a signature ____ the bottom of the letter.
A row of trees grows ____ the river.
You’ll find the information ____ the Internet.
The restaurant is ____ the end of the street.
There are stars ____ the sky tonight.
Put your name ____ the top of the form.
We’re meeting ____ the corner of Oak Street and Hill Road.
He’s standing ____ the back of the queue.
She lives ____ a small island off the coast.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with in or at.

items.prompt: I’m exhausted. I’m going to stay ____ bed today.
My sister is ____ hospital after the operation.
He isn’t ____ work this week. He’s on holiday.
The kids are ____ school until 3 o’clock.
We’ll be ____ home all evening.

exercises.instruction: Put in in or at.

items.prompt: We met ____ a party last night.
I’ll see you ____ the airport at 11.
It was very hot ____ the theatre.
Let’s meet ____ the theatre at 7.30.
She’s ____ the doctor’s right now.
I was ____ Sam’s house yesterday.
There were a lot of people ____ the cinema.
I’ll wait for you ____ the station entrance.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences. Use the correct preposition or phrase.

items.prompt: We travelled ____ a train all night.
She was sitting ____ the back of the taxi.
I left my phone ____ the bus.
He got ____ the car and drove away.
We got ____ the bus at the next stop.
He fell asleep ____ the plane.
I’m going to work ____ my bike.
They got ____ the taxi and paid the driver.
We stopped ____ a small town for lunch.
They live ____ a village near the mountains.
I met her ____ a conference in Berlin.
There weren’t many passengers ____ the train.
I sat ____ the front seat of the car.
We’ll change trains ____ Manchester.
She spends most of the day ____ home.
He’s still ____ prison.

exercises.instruction: Put in to, in, at, into, or leave it empty (—).

items.prompt: We’re going ____ the cinema tonight.
I arrived ____ the airport at 6 a.m.
They arrived ____ Canada yesterday.
How do I get ____ your house from here?
She went ____ home early because she felt ill.
I got ____ work late this morning.
When we got ____ the hotel, it was full.
The train arrived ____ Paris on time.
I walked ____ the room without knocking.
Put the letter ____ the envelope.
We went ____ a party after dinner.
What time did you arrive ____ the office?
He drove ____ the garage and parked.
They came ____ my place for coffee.
I’m going ____ bed. I’m exhausted.
She came ____ the kitchen and sat down.
We stopped ____ a small town on the way.
After the meeting, I went straight ____ home.

exercises.instruction: Complete with to, at, in, into or — (no word).

items.prompt: I’ve been ____ Italy twice.
Have you ever been ____ New York?
When I got ____ home, it was raining.
We stayed ____ home all weekend.
They arrived ____ the station too late.

exercises.instruction: Choose the correct answer.

items.prompt: What time did you arrive ____ London?
I arrived ____ the hotel after midnight.
Did you get ____ the station easily?
She’s gone ____ the shop. She’ll be back soon.
He went ____ home by taxi.
We ran ____ the building to get warm.

exercises.instruction: Complete with a suitable preposition.

items.prompt: He got ____ the car and shut the door.
Take your jacket ____ and sit down.
She put the books ____ the shelf.
The cat jumped ____ the table.
I poured the water ____ a glass.
He fell ____ his bike.

exercises.instruction: Complete with in, on or at.

items.prompt: We got caught ____ the rain on the way home.
I saw the match ____ TV last night.
He learned Spanish ____ university.
Please pay ____ cash if you can.
She first drove a car ____ the age of 17.
I spoke to her ____ the phone.
The sign is written ____ French.
____ the time, we didn’t have internet at home.

exercises.instruction: Put in in, on or at.

items.prompt: I heard the news ____ the radio.
Don’t drive ____ 120 km/h on this road.
We sat outside ____ the sun.
I’m not good at speaking ____ public.
They’re away ____ holiday until Monday.
I don’t like walking home ____ the dark.
He’s ____ a trip in Spain right now.
She was shouting ____ the phone.
He left home ____ 19.
____ the time, I didn’t own a car.
I saw your post ____ the internet.
We walked home ____ silence.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with a suitable preposition.

items.prompt: She’s ____ a good mood today.
I met him ____ my way to work.
The children were playing ____ the shade.
He spoke to me ____ the phone for an hour.
The programme is ____ TV again tonight.
Please answer ____ English.
They paid ____ cash.
He’s been ____ love with her for years.
I saw a deer ____ the distance.
We’re going away ____ business next week.
The car was travelling ____ 60 km/h.
She left school ____ 16.
____ the time, I didn’t have a smartphone.
I heard it ____ the radio this morning.
We waited outside ____ the rain.
They’re ____ a short trip to Italy.
He was driving too fast ____ the time.
I saw it ____ the internet yesterday.
____ my opinion, it’s too risky.
I can’t talk ____ the moment.

exercises.instruction: Choose the correct phrase.

items.prompt: I didn’t plan it. I met her ____.
Sorry — I sent the message to the wrong person ____.
This scarf was made ____ (not by machine).
Can I pay ____?
Send me the photo ____ when you can.
I repaired the bike ____ (without help).

exercises.instruction: Put in by, in or on.

items.prompt: I usually travel ____ train.
I came here ____ my bike.
She was sitting ____ a taxi when I called.
We went to the island ____ ferry.
He fell asleep ____ the bus.
They went to the airport ____ car.
I spent the whole journey ____ the plane reading.
We arrived ____ my brother’s car.
She prefers travelling ____ bus rather than driving.

exercises.instruction: Choose the correct ending.

items.prompt: I was woken up ____ in the middle of the night.
This painting was done ____.
My arm was covered in bites. I’d been bitten ____.
The goal was scored ____.
The window was smashed ____ during the storm.
These portraits were taken ____.
The music is a symphony ____.

exercises.instruction: Put in by, in, on or with.

items.prompt: I contacted them ____ email.
Write your name ____ the form, please.
I met an old friend ____ the train.
He opened the box ____ a knife.
The package was sent ____ air mail.
We stayed warm ____ walking fast.
The letter was written ____ hand.
I listen to podcasts ____ headphones.
Can I pay ____ credit card?
We arrived ____ my friend’s car.
I heard the announcement ____ the radio.

exercises.instruction: Complete with by + an amount.

items.prompt: Last year the company made 12% more profit. Profit increased ____ 12%.
The train was 15 minutes late. It arrived late ____ 15 minutes.
Team A scored 4 goals and Team B scored 2. Team A won ____ 2 goals.
Yesterday it cost €48; today it’s €45. The price fell ____ €3.

exercises.instruction: Complete with a suitable noun + preposition.

items.prompt: She explained why she was leaving. She gave me a clear ____ leaving.
More people want apartments in the centre. There is strong ____ flats in the centre.
We found a way to fix the issue. We found a ____ the issue.
Prices went up quickly. There was a sharp ____ prices.
The storm caused a lot of problems. The storm was the ____ the damage.
He has a very positive ____ his job.
Their friendship is very close. They have a strong ____ each other.
There’s a link ____ the two events.
The keys were damaged. There was ____ the keys.
I got a card asking me to come. I received an ____ the wedding.

exercises.instruction: Complete with the correct preposition.

items.prompt: The company has a big demand ____ skilled workers.
The cause ____ the accident is unknown.
There has been an increase ____ rent prices.
What’s the solution ____ this problem?
I don’t understand his attitude ____ work.
There’s a difference ____ these two models.
Do you have a relationship ____ your neighbours?
The map ____ the city is in this guidebook.
There was a fall ____ sales last month.
We got an invitation ____ the launch event.

exercises.instruction: Put in the correct preposition.

items.prompt: There’s no excuse ____ being rude.
The police are investigating the cause ____ the fire.
We’ve seen a decrease ____ accidents on this road.
What was his reaction ____ the news?
There is a connection ____ diet and health.
I have regular contact ____ my family abroad.
There’s been a rise ____ fuel prices.
She showed me a photo ____ her new house.
We need a key ____ the front door.
Is there any need ____ another meeting?
There’s a big difference ____ ‘can’ and ‘could’.
The storm did serious damage ____ the roof.
They found the answer ____ the question quickly.
There was an advantage ____ taking the early train.

exercises.instruction: Complete using adjective + of (and the person).

items.prompt: You paid for everyone’s coffee. It was ____ to do that. (use: generous)
You didn’t check the address and sent it to the wrong place. It was ____ to do that. (use: careless)
I told them my password. It was ____ to do that. (use: stupid)
You came to help without being asked. It was ____ to come. (use: nice)
He laughed at her mistake. It was ____ to laugh. (use: unkind)
She spoke in front of 500 people. It was ____ to do that. (use: brave)

exercises.instruction: Put in the correct preposition.

items.prompt: I’m angry ____ the noise next door.
She was angry ____ her brother for lying.
I’m tired ____ hearing the same complaint.
He’s bored ____ his job.
We were surprised ____ the result.
Everyone was impressed ____ her English.
I’m sorry ____ the confusion.
I’m sorry ____ being late.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with a suitable preposition.

items.prompt: It was very kind ____ you to call.
They’re always polite ____ customers.
I’m annoyed ____ the mistake in the bill.
She was annoyed ____ me for forgetting.
Are you angry ____ what happened?
Don’t be angry ____ him. It wasn’t his fault.
I’m fed up ____ this weather.
He’s bored ____ staying at home.
I’m tired ____ waiting.
We were amazed ____ how fast it was.
I was shocked ____ the news.
They were impressed ____ the way she handled it.
I’m sorry ____ the mess in the kitchen.
I apologised and said I was sorry ____ shouting.
I feel sorry ____ people who are lonely.
It was stupid ____ me to trust him.
She’s very friendly ____ everyone.
We were surprised ____ the price.
He was surprised ____ the invitation.
I’m annoyed ____ having to repeat myself.
She was impressed ____ his patience.
I’m tired ____ this argument.
They were angry ____ the decision.
I’m sorry ____ what I said earlier.
